say_hello[source]

say_hello(to)

Say hello to somebody

{% endraw %}

We can use this function to say hello to anybody, but lets say hello to Fredrik

{% raw %} 
say_hello("Fredrik")

'Hello Fredrik!'
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
from IPython.display import display,SVG
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
display(SVG('<svg height="100"><circle cx="50" cy="50" r="40" fill="red"/></svg>'))
{% endraw %} {% raw %} 
assert say_hello("Fredrik")=="Hello Fredrik!l"

{% endraw %}

The test below can be hidden, but it can be a good ide to show some of them.

{% raw %} 
test_eq(say_hello("Fredrik"),"Hello Fredrik!l")

---------------------------------------------------------------------------
AssertionError                            Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-26-d13842a7f933> in <module>
----> 1 test_eq(say_hello("Fredrik"),"Hello Fredrik!l")

/opt/homebrew/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fastcore/test.py in test_eq(a, b)
     34 def test_eq(a,b):
     35     "`test` that `a==b`"
---> 36     test(a,b,equals, '==')
     37 
     38 # Cell

/opt/homebrew/anaconda3/lib/python3.8/site-packages/fastcore/test.py in test(a, b, cmp, cname)
     24     "`assert` that `cmp(a,b)`; display inputs and `cname or cmp.__name__` if it fails"
     25     if cname is None: cname=cmp.__name__
---> 26     assert cmp(a,b),f"{cname}:\n{a}\n{b}"
